item.title: OpenGL Texture Mip Targeting
item.description: A while back, I was implementing a bloom post process effect for my personal renderer project, and I ran into an interesting hurdle involving how texture samplers and framebuffers work in OpenGL. A pretty common technique used by several engines involves repeated downsamples of the final (HDR) frame using a specialized blur kernel, and then a series of upsamples in reverse that accumulate the blurred textures, resulting in a nice and natural-looking bloom effect after tone mapping.
